item.title: Leanne add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "I don't remember lighting this cigarette and I don't remember if I'm here alone or waiting for someone." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description:
"In My Secret Life"
"I saw you this morning, you were moving so fast. Can't seem to loosen my grip On the past. And I miss you so much, there's no one in sight. And we're still making love In my secret life. I smile when I am angry, I cheat and I lie, I do what I have to do to get by, In my secret life." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Friend, when you speak this carefully I know it is because you don't know what to say." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Leanne add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "If our sex life were determined by our first youthful experiments, most of the world would be doomed to celibacy. In no area of human experience are human beings more convinced that something better can be had only if they persevere." -- P.D. James

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "I'm going to smile, and my smile will sink down into your pupils, and heaven knows what it will become." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Do a loony-goony dance 'Cross the kitchen floor, Put something silly in the world That ain't been there before." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Leanne add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "But better to get hurt by the truth than comforted with a lie." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: Leanne add a quote by George Plimpton
item.description: "I have never been convinced there's anything inherently wrong in having fun. " -- George Plimpton

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Ben Jonson
Leanne add a quote by Lucille Clifton
item.description: "may you kiss the wind then turn from it certain that it will love your back" -- Lucille Clifton

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Annie Proulx
item.description: "You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music." -- Annie Proulx

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Anne Bradstreet
item.description: "Sweet words are like honey, a little may refresh, but too much gluts the stomach." -- Anne Bradstreet

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart." -- Confucius

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Champagne, if you are seeking the truth, is better than a lie detector." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Thomas Keneally
item.description: "Whoever saves one life, saves the world entire." -- Thomas Keneally

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "The apparition of these faces in the crowd; Petals on a wet black bough." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Leanne add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Leanne add a quote by Nadine Gordimer
item.description: "The truth isn't always beauty, but the hunger for it is." -- Nadine Gordimer
